review: We were trying to cut the cable/satellite cord and purchased the Amazon Fire TV Stick since we are prime members and wanted to leverage our membership as much as possible.The Fire Stick works very well, very easy to navigate around in it.  Lot's of choices for streaming apps.  We had previously purchased a Chromecast stick but it was glitchy and did not have near as many apps.  If you are prime member, the Fire TV works seamlessly with the membership for watch all of the prime content.The only complaint, not just about the Fire TV, but about all of these streaming devices (Chromecast, Roku, etc...) is that in order to access the full content on a lot of the channels, one must have a subscription to a cable/satellite provider.  The Disney channels, Lifetime, Encore and more all have you go to a web site to register and as a part of the registration process, you have to log in with your TV service provider credentials.  The whole point was to get away from cable/sat. providers.  If I had subscription to cable TV, why would I need a steaming device?  Seems silly to me but that's the way the system works, for now anyway.Overall, I am happy with the Amazon Fire TV Stick.  We use is almost every day and even without the full content on some stations, there still is quite a selection to watch.
